title: A journal of a residence ... in London; including excursions through various parts of England; and a short tour in France and Scotland; in the years 1823 and 1824
author: Wheaton, Nathaniel Sheldon.
snippet: Sir Walter Scott thus describes the object of our visit:" This is a beautiful cascade made at a place called theBridge of Bracklinn, by a mountain stream called the Keltie,about a mile from the village of Callender, in Menteith.

title: Travels in Scotland: translated from the German. With notes by the translator [John Kesson]
author: Kohl, Johann Georg.
snippet: But besides this, there are several other distinguishedfamilies who bear the name of Drummond, as the " Drummondsof Slrathallan," the "Drummonds of Comrie," the " Drummondsof Blair-Drummond," the "Drummonds of Hawthornden," the"Drummonds of Keltie," aud the "Drummonds of Kinnoul."
